title: Classic Clothing Brands
description: How well do you remember the clothing brands that filled American closets and department stores?

questions.question: Which iconic American jeans brand, founded during the Gold Rush in 1853, was the original maker of riveted denim work pants?
questions.explanation: Levi Strauss & Co., founded in 1853, created the first riveted denim jeans in 1873, which evolved from workwear into an American fashion icon.

questions.question: Which preppy clothing brand, founded in 1818, was known as 'the' place for men's button-down Oxford shirts?
questions.explanation: Brooks Brothers, founded in 1818, is America's oldest clothing retailer and introduced the button-down collar shirt, becoming synonymous with preppy style.

questions.question: Which brand's alligator logo became a status symbol on polo shirts starting in the 1950s?
questions.explanation: Lacoste, founded by tennis player Rene Lacoste in 1933, featured its signature crocodile (often called an alligator) logo and became a status symbol in American fashion.

questions.question: Which jeans brand became a 1980s sensation with its tight-fitting designer denim and provocative ads featuring Brooke Shields?
questions.explanation: Calvin Klein Jeans exploded onto the scene in 1980 with the famous ad featuring 15-year-old Brooke Shields saying 'Nothing comes between me and my Calvins.'

questions.question: Which women's clothing brand, featuring a swan logo, was known for its affordable housedresses and was sold through catalogs and variety stores?
questions.explanation: Swirl dresses, with their distinctive wrap design and cheerful prints, were popular and affordable housedresses that many women wore at home in the 1950s and 1960s.

questions.question: Which shirt brand was famous for its 'The Man in the Arrow Shirt' advertisements featuring handsome, clean-cut models?
questions.explanation: Arrow Shirts ran the iconic 'Arrow Collar Man' advertising campaign, featuring impossibly handsome models that set the standard for men's dress shirt advertising.

questions.question: Which designer jeans brand, with a distinctive horsehead logo on the back pocket, was a must-have for teens in the early 1980s?
questions.explanation: Jordache jeans, with their embroidered horsehead logo, became one of the hottest designer jean brands of the late 1970s and early 1980s.

questions.question: Which women's blouse brand was famous for its tailored button-down shirts and the tagline 'Ship 'n Shore, the shirt that goes with everything'?
questions.explanation: Ship 'n Shore was one of the most popular women's blouse brands of the 1950s and 1960s, known for affordable, well-made button-down shirts.

questions.question: Which underwear brand featured the slogan 'When you've got it, flaunt it' and an Inspector character checking quality?
questions.explanation: Hanes underwear became well-known through its Inspector #12 quality-control character in commercials and its comfortable, affordable undergarments.

questions.question: Which outdoor clothing company, founded in 1912 in Maine, was known for its rubber-bottomed 'Bean Boots' and mail-order catalog?
questions.explanation: L.L.Bean, founded by Leon Leonwood Bean in 1912, became famous for its Maine Hunting Shoe (Bean Boot) and its beloved mail-order catalog.

questions.question: Which hosiery brand used the tagline 'Our L'eggs fit your legs' and sold pantyhose in distinctive egg-shaped containers?
questions.explanation: L'eggs pantyhose, introduced in 1969, revolutionized hosiery marketing by selling in plastic egg-shaped containers in supermarkets and drugstores.

questions.question: Which brand of men's work clothes was known for its bib overalls and the tagline 'the right fit for hard work'?
questions.explanation: OshKosh B'Gosh, founded in 1895, was famous for its durable bib overalls for farmers and workers before also becoming popular for children's clothing.

questions.question: Which fashion designer introduced 'designer jeans' for women in 1978, putting her name on the back pocket?
questions.explanation: Gloria Vanderbilt launched her signature designer jeans in 1978, helping start the designer jeans craze. Her embroidered swan logo became instantly recognizable.

questions.question: Which brand of men's dress shirts advertised with a distinguished model wearing an eye patch?
questions.explanation: The 'Man in the Hathaway Shirt' ads, created by David Ogilvy in 1951, featured a distinguished-looking model wearing an eye patch, making it one of advertising's most iconic campaigns.

questions.question: Which sportswear brand, founded by a German immigrant in 1948, featured three parallel stripes and became iconic for track suits?
questions.explanation: Adidas, founded by Adi Dassler in 1949, became famous for its three-stripe logo. Its track suits and athletic wear became fashionable casual clothing by the 1970s and 1980s.
